project_description: A simple Flutter app that displays a text of a cat with a clock icon. When the text is clicked, it changes to a dog with a person icon.
architecture_overview: The application uses the Cubit pattern for state management. It is highly modularized with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. The main screen displays a text with an icon, and the state is managed by a Cubit.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: click
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> Animal: Change state
Animal -> HomeScreen: Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using Cubit. The AnimalCubit manages the state of the animal text and icon. When the user clicks on the text, the toggleAnimal method is called, which toggles the current animal state and updates the UI accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, that displays the AnimalTextWidget. There is no complex navigation structure in this simple app.
